etymology.description: Depicts a head with the stylized representation of eyes and hair
etymology.interpretation: The character 首(首) (shǒu, 'head') depicts a head, with the top portion representing hair and a central line suggesting a facial feature, effectively conveying the concept of a head.

examples.chinese: 他昂首挺胸走上领奖台(他昂首挺胸走上領獎台)。
examples.pinyin: Tā áng shǒu tǐng xiōng zǒu shàng lǐng jiǎng tái.
examples.english: He walked onto the podium with his head held high.

examples.chinese: 受伤后(受傷後)，他低下首表示谦逊(他低下首表示謙遜)。
examples.pinyin: Shòu shāng hòu, tā dī xià shǒu biǎo shì qiān xùn.
examples.english: After being injured, he lowered his head to show humility.

examples.chinese: 他被选为公司的首席执行官(他被選為公司的首席執行官)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi xuǎn wéi gōng sī de shǒu xí zhí xíng guān.
examples.english: He was elected as the company's chief executive officer.
